Sentencas: Anode-supported solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs) with a state-of-the-art Ni/YSZ anode have been tested in simulated bio-syngas with controlled addition of phenol as a model molecule to study the influence of tars on the degradation of SOFCs operated with gasified biomass.
Titulo: Coupling SOFCs to biomass gasification - The influence of phenol on cell degradation in simulated bio-syngas. Part II - Post-test analysis

Sentencas: The post-test analysis results of SOFCs are described after operation with different concentrations of phenol.
Titulo: Coupling SOFCs to biomass gasification - The influence of phenol on cell degradation in simulated bio-syngas. Part II - Post-test analysis

Sentencas: The tests with pure syngas and up to 2 g/Nm(3) of phenol show a relatively stable performance in a short-term period of 500 h, but the test with 8 g/Nm(3) phenol shows drastic degradation.
Titulo: Coupling SOFCs to biomass gasification - The influence of phenol on cell degradation in simulated bio-syngas. Part II - Post-test analysis

Sentencas: The microstructural changes of anode and support layers, phase changes, and carbon deposition were analyzed and discussed based on performance degradation and post-test analysis.
Titulo: Coupling SOFCs to biomass gasification - The influence of phenol on cell degradation in simulated bio-syngas. Part II - Post-test analysis

Sentencas: No structural changes were found after tests with pure syngas.
Titulo: Coupling SOFCs to biomass gasification - The influence of phenol on cell degradation in simulated bio-syngas. Part II - Post-test analysis

Sentencas: On the other hand, the addition of phenol causes macro- and micro-scale structural changes in the support, spreading from the fuel inlet.
Titulo: Coupling SOFCs to biomass gasification - The influence of phenol on cell degradation in simulated bio-syngas. Part II - Post-test analysis

Sentencas: The support shows an erosion pattern and both Ni and YSZ were found as dust after the test.
Titulo: Coupling SOFCs to biomass gasification - The influence of phenol on cell degradation in simulated bio-syngas. Part II - Post-test analysis

Sentencas: In these eroded areas, carbon fibers were observed by SEM and it was more pronounced with higher phenol content.
Titulo: Coupling SOFCs to biomass gasification - The influence of phenol on cell degradation in simulated bio-syngas. Part II - Post-test analysis

Sentencas: There was no material phase transformation related to syngas or phenol, but surface carbon deposition was confirmed by Raman spectroscopy in the support and anode layers.
Titulo: Coupling SOFCs to biomass gasification - The influence of phenol on cell degradation in simulated bio-syngas. Part II - Post-test analysis
